com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Interface LabelRenderer

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseSimpleLabelRenderer, BaseValueMapLabelRenderer
public interface LabelRenderer

Responsible for auto-drawing the labels for Features in a FeatureLayer. Auto label drawing is normally performed by a LabelEngine.

Method Summary
 Fields getLabelFields()
          obtain the Fields used to provide text for labeling
 String getSeparator()
          obtain the String used to separate text when multiple LabelFields have been specified.
 void setLabelFields(Fields fields)
          you can set one or more Fields that will be used to provide text for labeling.
 void setSeparator(String separator)
          set the String used to separate text when multiple LabelFields have been specified
 

Method Detail

setLabelFields

public void setLabelFields(Fields fields)
you can set one or more Fields that will be used to provide text for labeling. If there are no label fields, then no labeling will occur for the associated Layer. If there is more than one Field, then text will be built by concatenating the text from each Field, and separated by the separator character

Parameters:
fields - the label fields, null == clear labeling
See Also:
setSeparator(java.lang.String)

getLabelFields

public Fields getLabelFields()
obtain the Fields used to provide text for labeling

Returns:
the label fields
See Also:
setLabelFields(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Fields)

setSeparator

public void setSeparator(String separator)
set the String used to separate text when multiple LabelFields have been specified

Parameters:
separator - the separator String
See Also:
setLabelFields(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Fields)

getSeparator

public String getSeparator()
obtain the String used to separate text when multiple LabelFields have been specified. By default this will normally be a single blank character.

Returns:
the separator String
See Also:
setSeparator(java.lang.String)
